title: Font ID request - GDB logo
content:
I cannot for the life of me figure out what this is, but I’m \*sure\* I own it somewhere (the open “D” I recognised instantly).

Tried Identifont (Antique Olive), and Whatthefont (something else entirely).

If it’s screamingly obvious I will do my 100 Hail Marys, &tc.

Cheers,

s

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071105030010im_/http:/typophile.com/files/gdb-logo_5976.gif)

 [‹ Filippo Berio](http://web.archive.org/web/20071105030010/http:/typophile.com/node/38789 "Go to previous forum topic") [Carbon Neutral font ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071105030010/http:/typophile.com/node/38788 "Go to next forum topic")
author: nert

comments.content: At first glance it looks like Lucida Sans with some tweaking.

I think the ’D’ is just the ’G’ rotated 180 degrees with a little bit of modification.

- Lex
